content: UPD: ignore, it's already in master No, wrong branch
I force-pushed to this branch and Github doesn't update the PR

I don't see anything on https://githubstatus.com but it looks to me like all of mathlib4's CI jobs have been stuck queued for several hours: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions

Is this just affecting mathlib? It looks like lean4 CI is working fine...

Batteries seems to be affected as well: https://github.com/leanprover-community/batteries/actions

Maybe leanprover-community is getting throttled...?

There are various limits described in this help page, but from a quick glance, I don't see anything that explains what we're seeing (all jobs in the org being queued for hours). It's late here now so I won't be able to do this, but if this doesn't resolve quickly, perhaps another maintainer can look into contacting GitHub support?
This looks like a side effect of me creating the mathlib4-nightly-testing fork, and copying many branches across to it.
I think we need to just cancel all actions there.

I'm not sure if that cancels all running jobs -- when I disabled actions on my fork recently, I remember getting error messages from some scheduled jobs a few hours later. In case it doesn't, I think gh can be used to cancel jobs in bulk.
